titleStmt.title: The lamb contending with the lion. By Christopher Chisman, a free commoner of England, who was unjustly apprehended (contrary to the law,) and detained prisoner in White Hall 18. daies, without any crime laid to his charge, as in this ensuing discourse is further manifested. Whereunto is annexed a letter sent by the foresaid Cornet Chisman, to the Lievt. Gen. Cromwel: with his answer thereunto.
titleStmt.author: Cheesman, Christopher.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by the same authority which caused the Army to oppose the Parliament,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

person.persName: the same authority which caused the Army to oppose the Parliament
